fresh_translation.text: One night, a smart teacher named Nicodemus, who was a leader of the Jews and part of a group that loved God's laws, came to see Jesus. He was curious and wanted to ask Jesus questions and learn more about Him.

related_verses.text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, the crowds were amazed at his teaching.

Yet at the same time many even among the leaders believed in him. But because of the Pharisees they would not openly acknowledge their faith for fear they would be put out of the synagogue.

translation_notes: In this update, I want to keep the language very simple for a seven-year-old while emphasizing who Nicodemus is and the special things Jesus does. I will briefly explain that a Pharisee is a kind of teacher who knows a lot about God's laws. I will also clarify that Jesus's amazing acts are miracles that show He is from God. This should help a young reader understand the spiritual importance of the conversation.

fresh_translation.text: One night, a Jewish teacher named Nicodemus, who was a Pharisee (which means he was a teacher of God’s laws), came to learn from Jesus. He said, 'Rabbi, we know you are from God because no one can do the miracles you do unless God is with him.'

fresh_translation.text: Nicodemus asked Jesus, "How can someone be born again when they are already old? Can they go back into their mom's tummy to be born?" Jesus replied, "Listen carefully! No one can see God's Kingdom unless they start over in a special way. To do this, people must be born of water, which means being baptized, and also be born of God's Spirit, which is what helps us believe in Jesus and changes our hearts. This new life means that we trust in Jesus to save us and bring us close to God!"

source: λέγει πρὸς αὐτὸν ὁ Νικόδημος· πῶς δύναται ἄνθρωπος γεννηθῆναι γέρων ὤν; μὴ δύναται εἰς τὴν κοιλίαν τῆς μητρὸς αὐτοῦ δεύτερον εἰσελθεῖν καὶ γεννηθῆναι; ἀπεκρίθη Ἰησοῦς· ἀμὴν ἀμὴν λέγω σοι, ἐὰν μή τις γεννηθῇ ἐξ ὕδατος καὶ Πνεύματος, οὐ δύναται εἰσελθεῖν εἰς τὴν βασιλείαν τοῦ Θεοῦ.

The emphasis on being part of God's family should also be straightforward and inclusive. fresh_translation.text: When a baby is born, they come from their mom, which is physical birth. But when someone believes in Jesus, they have a special spiritual birth through God's Spirit. This means they get a new heart that helps them believe in Jesus and live for God. When we get baptized, it shows that we believe in Jesus and want to follow Him. This new life helps us love others and be part of God's family, growing together with His love!

fresh_translation.text: So, I want you to understand that everyone needs to believe in Jesus to have a special new life from God, like being 'born again.' This means God gives you a new heart that helps you love others and enjoy a joyful life with Him, becoming part of His big family.

fresh_translation.text: No one has gone up to Heaven, except for Jesus, who came down from Heaven. He is called the Son of Man. He knows a lot about Heaven because He has been there. fresh_translation.text: Anyone who believes in Jesus, God’s special Son, will not be lost but will have life that lasts forever with God. fresh_translation.text: If you believe in God’s Son, Jesus, you will be safe with Him and close to Him forever because God loves you! But if you don’t believe in Him, you are not close to Him, and that means you can’t enjoy His love and friendship.

source: ὁ πιστεύων εἰς αὐτὸν οὐ κρίνεται, ὁ δὲ μὴ πιστεύων ἤδη κέκριται, ὅτι μὴ πεπίστευκεν εἰς τὸ ὄνομα τοῦ μονογενοῦς υἱοῦ τοῦ Θεοῦ.

related_verses.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, 'I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.'
For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light.
You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden.
For God, who said, 'Let light shine out of darkness,' made his light shine in our hearts to give us the light of the knowledge of God’s glory displayed in the face of Christ.

translation_notes: To create a translation for John 3:19 that is appropriate for a seven-year-old, I'll focus on the themes of light and darkness as symbols for Jesus and sin. The new version will clearly indicate the consequences of choosing darkness over light while maintaining the emphasis on God's love and the importance of our choices. I'll also aim to introduce the concept of judgment in a gentle way that aligns with the understanding of a child.

fresh_translation.text: Here’s what’s really important: God sent Jesus to be a bright light that shows us how to do good things. But some people don’t want to follow the light and choose to stay in the dark, which means they are far away from God. When they stay in the dark, they miss out on God’s love and happiness. This is a big choice, and it shows that they are not living the way God wants. God loves us and wants us to be close to Him, but we have to choose to follow the light to really know His love.

source: αὕτη δέ ἐστιν ἡ κρίσις, ὅτι τὸ φῶς ἐλήλυθεν εἰς τὸν κόσμον, καὶ ἠγάπησαν οἱ ἄνθρωποι μᾶλλον τὸ σκότος ἢ τὸ φῶς· ἦν γὰρ πονηρὰ αὐτῶν τὰ ἔργα.

related_verses.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light.
If we say we have fellowship with him while we walk in darkness, we lie and do not practice the truth.
But the way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they do not know over what they stumble.
Therefore be careful lest the light in you be darkness.

translation_notes: To create a more effective paraphrase of John 3:20 that is understandable for a seven-year-old, I will emphasize the consequences of staying in the dark and the loving invitation from God. I will also simplify language and structure to enhance flow, ensuring that it aligns with conservative Christian teachings about sin, accountability, and repentance. The final paraphrase will build directly upon the context established in John 3:19, focusing on God's love and guidance while addressing the idea of making better choices.

fresh_translation.text: Some people choose to do bad things, and they try to hide from God’s light because they are afraid of being told they did something wrong. But God’s light is here to show us how much He loves us and to help us make better choices. When we stay in the dark, we miss out on God's happiness and love. God really wants us to come into His light, admit when we've made mistakes, and let Him help us do what is right. He loves us and is always ready to forgive us when we turn back to Him.

source: πᾶς γὰρ ὁ φαῦλα πράσσων μισεῖ τὸ φῶς καὶ οὐκ ἔρχεται πρὸς τὸ φῶς, ἵνα μὴ ἐλεγχθῇ τὰ ἔργα αὐτοῦ·

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse is closely related to the previous one, as it contrasts the actions of those who do wrong with those who seek to do right. However, it can still stand alone with its meaning intact.

related_verses.text: Jesus spoke to them, saying, "I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life."
For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light.
But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, purifies us from all sin.
In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
The night is nearly over; the day is almost here. So let us put aside the deeds of darkness and put on the armor of light.

translation_notes: I will incorporate the teachers' suggestions by highlighting the importance of honesty and the connection between good deeds and God's guidance. I will maintain simple language suitable for a seven-year-old, ensuring that the concepts of light and darkness from the previous verse are preserved. I'll also make sure to emphasize Jesus as the light without implying any lack of genuine desire to follow God.

fresh_translation.text: But when people are honest and choose to do what is right, they come into God's light. This shows everyone that their good actions are because they want to please God and that God helps them do those good things.

source: ὁ δὲ ποιῶν τὴν ἀλήθειαν ἔρχεται πρὸς τὸ φῶς, ἵνα φανερωθῇ αὐτοῦ τὰ ἔργα, ὅτι ἐν Θεῷ ἐστιν εἰργασμένα.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The ideas in these verses flow well together, but they do not require rearranging or merging into one verse.

related_verses.text: Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.
Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
And Peter said to them, "Repent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit."
Now Jesus learned that the Pharisees had heard that he was gaining and baptizing more disciples than John.
And Paul said, "John baptized with the baptism of repentance, telling the people to believe in the one who was to come after him, that is, Jesus."

translation_notes: I will revise the translation to further simplify certain phrases and incorporate clearer theological points regarding baptism and faith. The aim is to ensure a seven-year-old can easily understand the essential meanings while respecting the core message of the scripture. I will break down complex ideas into simpler language, ensuring clarity around repentance and the importance of following Jesus. Additionally, I will keep the focus on the loving relationship with God and the community aspect of being baptized.

fresh_translation.text: After that, Jesus and His friends went to Judea. There, Jesus taught the people how to love God and each other. He baptized people in water to show they wanted to say sorry for doing wrong things and wanted to follow Him as their leader. This baptism was a special sign that showed they believed in Jesus and wanted to be part of God's family, promising to live the way God wants us to live.

source: Μετὰ ταῦτα ἦλθεν ὁ Ἰησοῦς καὶ οἱ μαθηταὶ αὐτοῦ εἰς τὴν Ἰουδαίαν γῆν, καὶ ἐκεῖ διέτριβε μετ᾽ αὐτῶν καὶ ἐβάπτιζεν.

related_verses.text: Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
And so John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about three thousand were added to their number that day.
We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.
This water symbolizes baptism that now saves you also—not the removal of dirt from the body but the pledge of a clear conscience toward God.

translation_notes: I will focus on making the translation clearer and simpler for a seven-year-old. I will ensure to highlight John's role and the relationship between baptism, repentance, and God's forgiveness. I'll use direct phrases to connect these concepts in an engaging way that resonates with a child's understanding.

fresh_translation.text: At the same time, John the Baptist was in a place called Aenon, near Salim, where there was a lot of water. Many people came to John because they wanted to say they were sorry for the wrong things they did and wanted to be friends with God again. Baptism was a special way to show that they loved God and wanted to follow Jesus. John was helping them make a promise to follow God and be part of His family, just like Jesus was teaching everyone to do.

source: ἦν δὲ καὶ Ἰωάννης βαπτίζων ἐν Αἰνὼν ἐγγὺς τοῦ Σαλείμ, ὅτι ὕδατα πολλὰ ἦν ἐκεῖ, καὶ παρεγίνοντο καὶ ἐβαπτίζοντο·

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse doesn't need to come before the previous one; it provides additional information about John the Baptist that follows logically after discussing his activities.

related_verses.text: They confessed their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
So John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
John said to the crowds coming out to be baptized by him, "You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
I baptize with water, John replied, "but among you stands one you do not know.
Paul said, "John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus."

translation_notes: I need to make sure that my translation is simple and understandable for a seven-year-old, while still conveying the key ideas of John the Baptist's ministry and the act of baptism. I'll avoid complex phrases and redundancy, and clarify the context of John's imprisonment. I will also ensure that the emphasis on John preparing the way for Jesus is clear, without making the translation too long or complicated.

fresh_translation.text: At that time, John the Baptist was still teaching people about God, and he hadn’t been put in jail yet. Many people came to him to be baptized because they wanted to say sorry for the bad things they did and begin again with God. Baptism was a special sign that showed they loved God and wanted to follow the teachings of Jesus, just like John was showing them.

source: οὔπω γὰρ ἦν βεβλημένος εἰς τὴν φυλακὴν ὁ Ἰωάννης.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse stands alone in context and does not require rearranging with the previous verse to maintain its meaning.

related_verses.text: The next day John was there again with two of his disciples.

John answered them all, saying, 'I baptize you with water. But one who is more powerful than I will come, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.'
I baptize you with water for repentance. But after me comes one who is more powerful than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
Paul said, 'John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus.'
They came to John and said to him, 'Rabbi, that man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan—the one you testified about—look, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him.'

translation_notes: I will incorporate the feedback from my teachers to enhance clarity and context. I'll make sure to explain who John the Baptist is for young readers and clarify the role of the disciples in the discussion. Additionally, I'll include a bit more about the connection between John the Baptist's teachings and Jesus, while keeping the language simple and relatable for a seven-year-old.

fresh_translation.text: Some of John the Baptist's friends, who were called disciples, were talking to a Jewish man. They wanted to understand how to be clean in God's eyes and how to make God happy. They were curious about baptism, which is when people show God they're sorry for their mistakes and want to start fresh. John the Baptist taught everyone about this special sign of love and how it helps us follow Jesus.

source: Ἐγένετο οὖν ζήτησις ἐκ τῶν μαθητῶν Ἰωάννου μετὰ Ἰουδαίου περὶ καθαρισμοῦ.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: This verse does not need to be rearranged with the previous verse as it stands well on its own. However, it flows contextually from the previous conversation about baptism and followers of John.

related_verses.text: They confessed their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
And so John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
The next day John was there again with two of his disciples.
Paul said, "John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus."
When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized too. And as he was praying, heaven was opened.

translation_notes: The aim is to create a clear and respectful paraphrase for young readers, ensuring it highlights John's role, Jesus' identity, and the significance of baptism while simplifying complex ideas. I will combine the suggestions from my teachers to achieve an accurate yet comprehensible translation.

fresh_translation.text: Some of John's friends came to him and said, "Teacher, remember the special man you talked about? That is Jesus, the Son of God! He is baptizing people now, and many are coming to Him. Baptism shows that people want to love and follow God, just like you taught them. It's their way of saying they are sorry for their mistakes and want to start fresh with God!"

source: καὶ ἦλθον πρὸς τὸν Ἰωάννην καὶ εἶπον αὐτῷ· ῥαββί, ὃς ἦν μετὰ σοῦ πέραν τοῦ Ἰορδάνου, ᾧ σὺ μεμαρτύρηκας, ἴδε οὗτος βαπτίζει καὶ πάντες ἔρχονται πρὸς αὐτόν.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The ideas in this verse respond directly to the concerns raised in the previous verse, but they stand well on their own without needing to merge into a range. The concepts in JHN 3:27 clarify that everything we receive comes from God, which is a response but can be understood separately.

related_verses.text: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights.
Look at the birds of the air; they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?
For who sees anything different in you? What do you have that you did not receive? If then you received it, why do you boast as if you did not receive it?
Nor is he served by human hands, as though he needed anything, since he himself gives to all mankind life and breath and everything.
And my God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.

translation_notes: I want to keep the birthday gift analogy because it's relatable for kids, but I need to clarify that the good things from God include both physical and spiritual blessings. I will simplify the language to enhance clarity while maintaining the core message of the original text about God's gifts. I’ll ensure it connects well with the previous verse regarding baptism and following God.

fresh_translation.text: John replied, "No one can get good things unless God gives them to us. Just like on your birthday, you can only have a gift if someone gives it to you. Remember, all good things, like love and joy, come from God's heart, and they help us grow closer to Him!"

source: ἀπεκρίθη Ἰωάννης καὶ εἶπεν· οὐ δύναται ἄνθρωπος λαμβάνειν οὐδέν, ἐὰν μὴ ᾖ δεδομένον αὐτῷ ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The message in this verse stands alone, as it clarifies John’s role without requiring additional context from the previous verse.

related_verses.text: And this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, 'Who are you?'
This is he of whom it is written: 'Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.'
This is he of whom it is written, 'Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.'
He said, 'I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness: Make straight the way of the Lord,' as the prophet Isaiah said.
He must increase, but I must decrease.

translation_notes: I will integrate the corrections from my teachers to enhance clarity, emphasize John's humility and the importance of Jesus as the Messiah, and clarify John's role as a messenger who calls for repentance. I'll ensure the paraphrase remains relatable for a seven-year-old.

fresh_translation.text: John the Baptist said, 'You all remember that I told you I am not the Christ, the one everyone has been waiting for. I'm like a helper who gets everyone ready to meet Him. God sent me to tell people to turn away from their wrong choices and to prepare their hearts for Jesus, the true Savior.'

source: αὐτοὶ ὑμεῖς μοι μαρτυρεῖτε ὅτι εἶπον· οὐκ εἰμὶ ἐγὼ ὁ Χριστός, ἀλλ᾽ ὅτι ἀπεσταλμένος εἰμὶ ἔμπροσθεν ἐκείνου.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The meaning of this verse builds upon the previous one, emphasizing the joy of the friend of the bridegroom. However, it is not necessary to merge them into a single verse as they convey distinct thoughts that can stand alone while still being connected.

related_verses.text: Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten virgins who took their lamps and went to meet the bridegroom.
You all know that I told you, 'I am not the Christ.' I am just someone sent to tell you about Him.
Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her.
And I saw the holy city, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
And Jesus said to them, 'Can the wedding guests mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? The days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast.'

translation_notes: In updating the translation of John 3:29, I will focus on maintaining clarity for a seven-year-old audience while also preserving the theological significance of John's role in relation to Jesus. I will adjust the wording to enhance precision and ensure that the joy John expresses is conveyed appropriately. I aim to keep the relatable imagery of a groom and his friend while incorporating a more formal yet accessible tone that reflects conservative Christian values.

fresh_translation.text: John said, 'Jesus is like a groom who loves his bride. I am like a friend who helps the groom. When I hear the groom's voice, I am so happy! My joy is full because I get to tell everyone about Jesus. He is the one everyone has been waiting for.'

source: ὁ ἔχων τὴν νύμφην νυμφίος ἐστίν· ὁ δὲ φίλος τοῦ νυμφίου, ὁ ἑστηκὼς καὶ ἀκούων αὐτοῦ, χαρᾷ χαίρει διὰ τὴν φωνὴν τοῦ νυμφίου. αὕτη οὖν ἡ χαρὰ ἡ ἐμὴ πεπλήρωται.

thoughts_on_if_words_from_this_verse_sho: The joy expressed in the previous verse builds up to the importance of the bridegroom's presence and role. However, JHN 3:30 stands alone as it reflects on the necessary growth of the bridegroom in contrast to the decrease of the friend. Thus, no merging is necessary, but understanding the relationship helps appreciate the context.

related_verses.text: The one who has the bride is the bridegroom. But the friend who stands and listens to him is filled with joy when he hears the bridegroom's voice. This joy of mine is now complete.
In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves.
He must become greater; I must become less.
Then he said to them all: "Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross daily and follow me."

translation_notes: I need to revise the translation of John 3:30 to make it more concise while ensuring it maintains a sense of reverence for Jesus. I should clarify the idea of Jesus increasing and John decreasing without oversimplifying their roles. Using language that a seven-year-old can easily understand is key, but I must ensure that the phrases used are respectful and true to the scripture's intent.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus is the most important person, and He should grow bigger and bigger! I'm really happy to help everyone see how great He is. It's like when I step back so Jesus can shine brighter, that makes me joyful! I want everyone to know how amazing He is, and I'm excited to cheer for Him as He becomes even more wonderful.

source: ἐκεῖνον δεῖ αὐξάνειν, ἐμὲ δὲ ἐλαττοῦσθαι.

related_verses.text: They were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
He said to them, 'You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.'
For I have come down from heaven, not to do my own will, but the will of him who sent me.
No one has ascended into heaven except he who descended from heaven, the Son of Man.
The officers answered, 'No one ever spoke like this man!'
And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.

translation_notes: I need to revise the translation of JHN 3:31 to ensure it accurately conveys Jesus' divine authority while making it easy for a seven-year-old to understand. I will also focus on clarifying the differences between what people on earth know and what Jesus knows from heaven, ensuring the language is simple and relatable.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus is the one who came from heaven, and He is greater than everyone! People on earth can only talk about what they know from their own experiences, and sometimes they don't see the whole picture. But Jesus knows everything about God because He comes from heaven, where He understands all the truth. That's why He is above all other people! His knowledge and power make Him truly special.

source: ὁ ἄνωθεν ἐρχόμενος ἐπάνω πάντων ἐστίν. ὁ ὢν ἐκ τῆς γῆς ἐκ τῆς γῆς ἐστι καὶ ἐκ τῆς γῆς λαλεῖ· ὁ ἐκ τοῦ οὐρανοῦ ἐρχόμενος ἐπάνω πάντων ἐστί,

related_verses.text: The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us. We have seen his glory, the glory of the one and only Son, who came from the Father, full of grace and truth.
No one has ever seen God, but the one and only Son, who is himself God and is in closest relationship with the Father, has made him known.

Anyone who believes in the Son of God has this testimony in their heart. Anyone who does not believe God has made him out to be a liar because they have not believed the testimony God has given about his Son.
No one ever spoke the way this man does,” the guards replied.
Whoever listens to you listens to me; whoever rejects you rejects me; but whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.

translation_notes: In this revision, I want to keep the simple language while emphasizing Jesus' unique knowledge from God. I will introduce the idea of 'testifying' to explain that Jesus shares important truths. I will also address the theme of belief without overly emotional phrasing. The goal is to make sure it's clear that Jesus' message is important and that believing in it matters.

fresh_translation.text: Jesus tells us what He has seen and heard from God. He shares important truths, and it’s really important to believe Him. Some people have a hard time accepting what He says, but His message comes straight from God, and that makes it very special!

source: καὶ ὃ ἑώρακε καὶ ἤκουσε, τοῦτο μαρτυρεῖ, καὶ τὴν μαρτυρίαν αὐτοῦ οὐδεὶς λαμβάνει.

And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.

fresh_translation.text: When we believe what Jesus tells us, it shows that we trust God and know He tells the truth. Jesus is God's Son, and He shares special messages from God that help us understand what is true. Believing in Jesus is very important because it connects us to God's truth!

source: ὁ λαβὼν αὐτοῦ τὴν μαρτυρίαν ἐσφράγισεν ὅτι ὁ Θεὸς ἀληθής ἐστιν.

For I have not spoken on my own authority, but the Father who sent me has given me a commandment—what to say and what to speak.
For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.

I'll also make sure to avoid subjective language while ensuring it's relatable for a seven-year-old. fresh_translation.text: God sent Jesus to tell us God’s words. Jesus speaks what God wants us to hear because the Holy Spirit is with Him. This shows how special Jesus is, and we can trust Him to share what God says.

source: ὃν γὰρ ἀπέστειλεν ὁ Θεός, τὰ ῥήματα τοῦ Θεοῦ λαλεῖ· οὐ γὰρ ἐκ μέτρου δίδωσιν ὁ Θεὸς τὸ Πνεῦμα.

I and the Father are one.

This is how God showed his love among us: He sent his one and only Son into the world that we might live through him.

translation_notes: I want to create a translation that is simple for a seven-year-old to understand, while also reflecting the divine nature of Jesus and His relationship with God. fresh_translation.text: God loves Jesus very much and has given Him special power. This means that Jesus knows what God wants us to do. He cares for us and helps us in the right way, just like a really good leader. We can trust Jesus to guide us because He shares God's words with us.

source: ὁ πατὴρ ἀγαπᾷ τὸν υἱὸν καὶ πάντα δέδωκεν ἐν τῇ χειρὶ αὐτοῦ.

related_verses.text: For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
Very truly I tell you, whoever hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life and will not be judged but has crossed over from death to life.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.
Jesus answered, 'I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.'

translation_notes: To refine the translation for JHN 3:36, I'll emphasize the concept of eternal life more clearly and address the consequences of disbelief in a way that is understandable for a seven-year-old. I'll ensure the wording remains simple while accurately conveying the seriousness of the message without diluting its theological significance. I'll also align the paraphrase with the context established in JHN 3:35.

fresh_translation.text: If you believe in Jesus, you will have eternal life with God. But if you don't believe in Him, you won't have this special life. Instead, God is sad because He wants everyone to choose to love and trust Him, just like Jesus does.

source: ὁ πιστεύων εἰς τὸν υἱὸν ἔχει ζωὴν αἰώνιον· ὁ δὲ ἀπειθῶν τῷ υἱῷ οὐκ ὄψεται ζωήν, ἀλλ᾽ ἡ ὀργὴ τοῦ Θεοῦ μένει ἐπ᾽ αὐτόν.
